events.event_description: Three LNG projects advanced to construction phase following the signing of sale and purchase agreements totaling almost 22 million metric tons per year of LNG.
events.citation: Developers advanced three liquefied natural gas (LNG) projects to the construction phase in 2023, following the signing of sale and purchase agreements (SPA)—contracts specifying the terms and conditions of LNG supplies between seller and buyer—underpinning the projects. Developers signed contracts with buyers for almost 22 million metric tons per year of LNG last year

events.event_description: Venture Global began construction of Phase 2 of the Plaquemines export facility.
events.citation: Venture Global began construction of Phase 2 of the Plaquemines export facility in Louisiana.

events.event_description: Sempra began construction on the first phase of its Port Arthur project and NextDecade began construction of the first phase of the Rio Grande project.
events.citation: In Texas, Sempra began construction on the first phase of its Port Arthur project, and NextDecade began construction of the first phase of the Rio Grande project.

events.event_description: U.S. Department of Energy paused review of LNG export permits to countries without free trade agreements with the United States.
events.citation: DOE paused review of LNG export permits to countries with which the United States does not have a free trade agreement.
